solution_line_template: Twice the number of hours in a typical earth day is {hours_in_earth_day}*{multiplier_for_twice}=<<{hours_in_earth_day}*{multiplier_for_twice}={twice_earth_day_hours}>>{twice_earth_day_hours} hours.
Eight hours less than twice the number of hours in a typical earth day is {twice_earth_day_hours}-{hours_less}=<<{twice_earth_day_hours}-{hours_less}={travel_time_hours}>>{travel_time_hours} hours.

If the distance between these two planets is {distance_parsecs} parsecs, then the average speed on this voyage was {distance_parsecs}/{travel_time_hours}=<<{distance_parsecs}/{travel_time_hours}={average_speed}>>{average_speed} parsecs per hour.
